newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila overnight money dips in liquid market.
newsitem.headline: Manila overnight money dips in liquid market.

text.p: Manila overnight money dipped to an average of 10.53125 from 10.5625 percent in a liquid market, traders said on Wednesday.
"Unless there are fresh fundamental news, it will stay this liquid for quite some time," a big bank trader said.
Banks have remained liquid because they have been discouraged from investing in term reverse repos of one to three months which now have a 20 percent tax.
The Central Bank continued to borrow at an overnight rate at 10.5 percent. It had also re-offered five-day reverse repos which are exempted from the 20 percent tax, traders said.
Volume fell to 11.096 billion from 16.431 billion pesos, with 26 lenders and 19 borrowers.
Due to the high liquidity in the market, banks were buying short-term bills just to park the money they have not rolled over in term reverse repos, a trader said.
Banks gave bids of 10.60 to 10.75 percent on the three-month bills, according to a Reuter poll of seven institutions.
